page.title: 09FARMING N.BEDS/SW CAMBS cont
page.content: { LAND OWNERSHIP}Large investments since 1950 by Boots Chemist & other Company Pension Funds. Land then let. Most farms owner-occupied. Amalgamation of farms not uncommon. { LAND PRICES 1985}Price per acre for prime farm land has fallen from Â£2000 to Â£1800 due to falling returns as EEC reduces grain prices after vast surplus harvest of 1984. Bank loans on land at 15% interest. { SIZE OF FARMS }Average over 500 acres. Few smaller. Decline of small farms due to purchase of land by big companies plus economies of large scale farming. Mechanization important in area. Disappearance of farmhouses as small farms are absorbed. Makes redivision of farmland into smaller units more difficult. Few young farmers can buy farms.
